title: [K-12] Reflective Learning Design to Resolve Conflicts Between STEM and Catholic Education Systems

context.prior_knowledge: Secondary-level mathematics education experience or foundational understanding of Catholic educational philosophy
context.additional_context: Application of reflective teaching methods suitable for 30s adult learners in vocational training institutions. Implementation of blended learning using only smartphones and simple digital tools

learning_goals: Learners can identify at least three key conflict points between STEM education and Catholic educational philosophy.
Learners can design and implement reflective interviews with peer teachers using phenomenological analysis techniques.
Learners can propose at least two strategies for integrating scientific competencies and ethical values in learning design.
Learners can utilize digital collaboration tools to share reflective practice cases in limited technological environments.

resources: Summary of Ethical Guidelines for Catholic Education
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
